scenario:
Cisco Systems, Inc. CSCO shares are trading higher, having gained around 20% in the past year. Exposure to the stock can be gained via iShares U.S. Telecommunications ETF IYZ and First Trust NASDAQ Cybersecurity ETF CIBR. 

The company introduced Cisco AI Defense, an advanced solution to support and secure AI transformation within enterprises. This end-to-end solution secures both AI application development and deployment, protecting against AI misuse, data leakage, and sophisticated threats. 

In November 2024, Cisco reported revenue of $13.84 billion, beating analyst estimates of $13.77 billion. Adjusted earnings per share came in at 91 cents, exceeding the expected 87 cents per share. 

CEO Chuck Robbins emphasized the company's strategic position in AI-driven infrastructure investments. The company's Executive Vice President and Chief Product Officer, Jeetu Patel, stated that Cisco AI Defense combines the unique ability to detect and protect against threats without tradeoffs. 

CSCO shares are up 1.33% at $60.62 at the last check.
